title: United States passport
summary: United States passports are passports issued to citizens and nationals of the United States of America.[5] They are issued exclusively by the United States Department of State.[6] Besides passports (in booklet form), limited use passport cards are issued by the same government agency subject to the same requirements.[7] It is unlawful for U.S. citizens and nationals to enter or exit the United States without a valid U.S. passport or Western Hemisphere Travel Initiative-compliant passport-replacement document,[8][9] though there are many exceptions,[10] waivers are generally granted for U.S. citizens returning without a passport, and the exit requirement is not enforced.
